intro: Ribes weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer currant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Grossulariaceae. It is native to the Andes Mountains in South America, specifically in regions of Peru and Bolivia. The plant is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are usually pink to red in color and are followed by small, edible berries that are similar in appearance to gooseberries. It thrives in cool, temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
